stimulusHtml: A section of wire in a circuit has a current directed to the right. Which of the following statements correctly describes the motion of charged particles in the wire and the reason for that motion?
choicesHtml: Electrons have a net motion to the left due to an electric potential difference.
Electrons have a net motion to the right due to an electric potential difference.
Electrons have a net motion to the left due to the attraction from protons with a net motion to the right.
Electrons have a net motion to the right due to the attraction from protons with a net motion to the left.
